intro: [WRONG START] Media, commonly known as the "fairy lantern," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Media lewisii, which is native to the western United States. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Media plants often grow in dry, rocky habitats and are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
